channel.title: BBC News - Wales
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Covid: Welsh ambulances face unprecedented pressure, minister says
item.description: Health Minister Eluned Morgan says she's taking responsibility as military called in to drive vehicles.

item.title: Rhondda house fire: Man arrested after woman seriously hurt
item.description: A 28-year-old woman is in a critical condition and three children are treated for smoke inhalation.

item.title: Covid-19 in Wales: Under-16s cases spike as rates climb
item.description: The sharpest increase in rates of Covid-19 are seen in those under 16 years old, latest figures show.

item.title: Cardiff river death: Nicola Williams, 15, died after being swept away by current
item.description: Nicola Williams was playing with friends when she was dragged under water, an inquest hears.

item.title: Frisky male Llandudno goats get stuck pursuing females
item.description: Eighteen amorous billy goats were left stranded after chasing two females onto a rocky outcrop.

item.title: Dylan Garbe-Ashton died in police custody after taking cocaine
item.description: Dylan Garbe-Ashton hit his head during a seizure after taking cocaine, an inquest finds.

item.title: Seal disturbances: Second pup dies in Ceredigion
item.description: Visitors must take heed after two abandoned pups die and another is rescued, conservationists say.

item.title: Cardiff City to apply to be part of safe standing trial for fans
item.description: Cardiff City will apply to be part of a scheme to pilot safe standing areas for fans this season.

item.title: Illegal tobacco: HMRC and Trading Standards seize one million cigarettes in Wales
item.description: Yoyo the detection dog has sniffed out some of the Â£280k worth of illegal tobacco goods seized.

item.title: Denbighshire carer denies urinating on child's toothbrush
item.description: Rebecca Spencer also denies rubbing cutlery on her genitals and serving food laced with laxatives.

item.title: Netflix lands golden ticket by buying Roald Dahl estate
item.description: The streaming giant will own and control works like Charlie and the Chocolate Factory and Matilda.

item.title: US lifting ban on imports of British lamb, says Boris Johnson
item.description: The PM admits the UK is now aiming only for "incremental steps" on US trade, rather than a full agreement.

item.title: Wales' ambulance crews struggle with 'worst-ever' crisis
item.description: An ambulance worker says morale is low as hospitals struggle to cope with patient numbers.

item.title: Newport pupil looking for university 'suitable for black people'
item.description: People from minority or poorer backgrounds are less likely to be offered a place at Welsh universities.

item.title: Ceredigion: Plea to stay away from seals after pup death
item.description: People are warned not to approach seals after a pup died after visitors scared its mother away.

item.title: Covid: ICU consultant at Glangwili hospital describes pressure
item.description: An intensive care consultant says pressure is as intense as at any point during the past 18 months.

item.title: Nicola Faith fishing boat sinking: 'Grieving has only just started' for families
item.description: The families of three drowned fishermen are setting up a charity to improve sea safety.

item.title: Drink-drivers are selfish, says Ammanford woman hit by car
item.description: Finley Taylor was hit by a drink-driver as she walked her dog with her husband.

item.title: Brighton & Hove Albion 2-0 Swansea City: Aaron Connolly double sends Seagulls through
item.description: Aaron Connolly scores twice as Brighton reach round four of the Carabao Cup thanks to a 2-0 home win over Swansea City.

item.title: Wales' best chance to qualify for World Cup - Rhiannon Roberts
item.description: Defender Rhiannon Roberts believes Wales have their best chance to qualify for a major tournament after making an ideal start to their 2023 World Cup qualifying campaign.

item.title: Tomas Francis: Wales and Ospreys prop says 60-cap rule is working
item.description: New Ospreys prop Tomas Francis says the Welsh Rugby Union's 60-cap rule is working following his summer move from Exeter.

item.title: Premier League and Championship clubs invited to trial safe standing
item.description: Premier League and Championship clubs have been asked for expressions of interest to pilot safe standing this season.

item.title: Estonia 0-1 Wales: Feeling frustrated after games like that is what I want - boss Grainger
item.description: Manager Gemma Grainger is pleased her Wales players felt "frustrated" by their 1-0 World Cup qualifying win against Estonia.

item.title: Ambiwlansys 'erioed wedi gweld pwysau fel hyn'
item.description: Mae'r Gweinidog Iechyd yn mynnu ei bod yn cymryd cyfrifoldeb am y sefyllfa sy'n wynebu'r gwasanaeth.

item.title: Y cyflwynydd a'r cynhyrchydd radio Magi Dodd wedi marw
item.description: Daeth yn llais cyfarwydd ar raglenni C2 Radio Cymru ac fel cyflwynydd Dodd Com.

item.title: Pas Covid: 'Aros byth a hefyd' i addasu technoleg i Gymru
item.description: Er mwyn cael copi dwyieithog o'r pas Covid, rhaid gwneud cais am fersiwn bapur ar hyn o bryd.

item.title: Codi pwysau a newid byd
item.description: Sioned Halpin o Gydweli a'i siwrne i fod yn un o fenywod cryfa' Cymru

item.title: Cwpan yr EFL: Brighton 2-0 Abertawe
item.description: Abertawe allan o Gwpan y Gynghrair Lloegr wedi iddyn nhw gael eu trechu yn y drydedd rownd.
